title: The Green Well to open 2nd location, as restaurant eyes further expansion
text:
The Green Well to open 2nd location, as restaurant eyes further expansion IMG_0978.jpg The Green Well will open a second location this summer in downtown Rockford along the river. (Courtesy | Essence Restaurant Group) Shandra Martinez | smartinez@mlive.com By Shandra Martinez | smartinez@mlive.com The Grand Rapids Press on January 19, 2017 at 9:00 AM, updated January 19, 2017 at 9:10 AM comments 
ROCKFORD, MI - The Green Well will open a second location this summer in downtown Rockford, which may signal future expansion plans for the popular East Hills gastro pub. 
Green Well will move into the picturesque riverfront space that previously housed Reds on the River -- before the restaurant relocated to the Thousand Oaks Golf Club. 
Reds trades waterfront location for country club setting 
Parent company, Essence Restaurant Group, has signed a 10-year lease for the space in the Rockford Promenade Building at 8 East Bridge Street, said Victoria Mitchell, the agent with Ben Muller Realty Company, who represented building owner Daniel Trierweiler of DJT Properties, LLC in deal. 
"Since the space went vacant last summer, I have been determined to find the best next tenant for this beautiful setting," said Daniel Trierweiler, the property's owner. 
The Green Well, which has developed a strong following since opening its Cherry Street location in 2007, is eyeing looking at adding locations across the region, according to James Berg, managing partner for the Essence Restaurant Group, which also operates Grand Rapids eateries Bistro Bella Vita and the Grove. 
"Our Rockford location will allow the start of future growth for The Green Well brand without diluting what we have created on Cherry Street in Grand Rapids," said Berg, who grew up in Rockford. The Green Well Rockford will have indoor seating for 120 and capacity for 60 in the outdoor patio area. The interior and menu will be similar to the Cherry Street location but have a Rockford flavor, said Lauren Jaenicke, Essence's marketing and sustainability director. 
The restaurant plans to hire 35 to 40 new employees to staff the facility. The restaurant's buildout will create two new retail on both sides of the restaurant that will be around 1,300 square feet. "We are already talking to some upscale local retailers that are interested in these spaces," Mitchell said. Detroit Auto Show
